content: The "Social Security Fairness Act of 2002" is cited as the short title. Section 202 of the Social Security Act is amended to include a new subsection regarding the termination of the last monthly insurance benefit payment upon death. The Social Security Act is amended to include a provision for the payment of an individual's benefit after their death in the first 15 days of a month. The applicable dollar amount for any calendar year is $955, with adjustments made by the Commissioner of Social Security each year after 2002. The applicable dollar amount for any calendar year is $955, with adjustments made by the Commissioner of Social Security annually after 2002 based on the national average wage index. The dollar amount for the next calendar year is determined by multiplying $955 by the ratio of the national average wage index for the year before to the index for 2001. If the result is not a multiple of $5.00, it is rounded up to the nearest multiple of $5.00. The amendments made by this Act will be effective for deaths occurring after 90 days from the enactment date.
